text: in this video
we will use the inventory management
template to showcase how a button can
automate
overriding data or to put it simply how
a button can update information in your
tables
to demonstrate we'll start at the
inventory table
and look at echo show 3869
if a device is available you'll see
several blank cells like
who the device is assigned to the status
of the request
and when it was requested then when an
app user clicks the confirm button to
request the device
an automation will overwrite these blank
data cells with updated information
let's look at the my devices app and
runtime
we can see it shows devices from the
inventory table
and that the app user can request a
device like the amazon echo show
with the click of a button by clicking
the request button
the app navigates to the confirmation
screen summarizing the request
we'll click the confirm button and all
the updated information
is sent to your table as you can see
the inventory table has been updated
let's take a look at builder to see how
this works
the request button is set to perform two
actions
the first is to navigate the user to the
confirmation screen
the second is to set variables to
establish which
data is presented on the confirmation
screen
the find row formula in the take data
from field
is going to scan the inventory table and
return the first
rolling meaning the entire first row of
data
that meets two conditions
condition one is that the value in the
rows device column matches the value of
the device being requested
condition 2 is that the value in the
assigned
2 column is blank if it finds a row
that matches the conditions it returns a
row link that will write to the input
row variable
on the confirm screen let's use our
example to summarize this
when the echo show request button is
clicked
the inventory column is scanned to find
the first row that has
echo show in the device column that
also has an empty cell for the assign
2 column it will then take this row link
again that's an entire row of data and
write it to the confirmation screens
input row variable
lastly the blocks data source on the
confirmation
screen is set to this input row variable
which again
is the inventory table row link so
anything appearing in this block
unless otherwise specified is using the
data from the rolling
that's how the data is passing from one
screen to another
now let's look at the confirm button on
the confirmation screen
this is the button that updates the
table we can go to builder to see how
this is set up
when clicked the confirm button has an
automation that overwrites and updates
the inventory table row with three
pieces of data
the first overwrite action takes data
from the system user variable
which is the app user's name and writes
it to the assign
to column as a value the second action
uses the today formula which takes
today's date
and writes it to the requested on column
the third action uses the find row
function
in the status table to return the first
matching row
whose value in the status column
contains the word
requested it then writes this row link
to the status column in the inventory
table after clicking the confirm button
we can see the updated inventory table
data
thanks for watching
